text.quote: 42A*: Clause 1, page 1, line 9, at end insert—
“( ) Any referendum held under subsection (1) shall be consultative.”
42B*: Clause 1, page 1, line 9, at end insert—
“( ) A referendum under subsection (1) shall only be held if 1 million members of the electorate submit a petition to Parliament to that effect.”
42C*: Clause 1, page 1, line 9, at end insert—

“( ) A referendum under subsection (1) shall only be held provided that, not less than six months before the date on which the referendum is to take place, the Secretary of State has laid before both Houses of Parliament a report on any transfer of power from the United Kingdom to the European Union that has taken place since the passing of this Act, together with his or her assessment of why such transfer justifies the holding of the referendum.”
42D*: Clause 1, page 1, line 9, at end insert—

“( ) A referendum under subsection (1) shall only be held provided that, not less than six months before the date on which the referendum is to take place, the Secretary of State has laid before both Houses of Parliament a report on the review of competencies undertaken by Her Majesty’s Government, together with his or her assessment of why the findings of the review justify the holding of the referendum.”
42E*: Clause 1, page 1, line 9, at end insert—

“( ) A referendum under subsection (1) shall only be held provided that, not less than six months before the date on which the referendum is to take place, the Secretary of State has laid before both Houses of Parliament a report on any renegotiation of the United Kingdom’s relationship with the European Union that has taken place since the passing of this Act, together with his or her assessment of why such renegotiation justifies the holding of the referendum.”
